definition: to cast a glance
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: The child glanced at his angry father timidly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子怯生生地瞟了一眼怒氣衝衝的父親。

sentences.english: He read a few lines, and looked wrathfully at Berg.
sentences.chinese: 他念了幾行，便兇狠地瞟了貝格一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a sidelong glance with his pale, blue eyes, but did not reply.
sentences.chinese: 他用淡藍色的眼睛瞟了她一下，沒有吭聲。
她不滿地瞟了她丈夫一眼。

sentences.english: I glanced towards it once more.
Glancing quickly at me, she said, ” Take the shampoo and wash your hair.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速瞟了我一眼，說，“拿洗髮精洗洗你的頭髮。

sentences.english: Stealing a glance, I noticed her back was ramrod-straight.
sentences.chinese: 偷偷的瞟了她一眼，我發現她的背僵直着。

sentences.english: She watched him steal a glimpse at the marooned bus.
sentences.chinese: 她看到他偷偷瞟了一眼受阻的汽車。

sentences.english: She glanced at it and then tore it into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 然而她瞟了一眼協議，就把它撕了個粉碎。

sentences.english: Elizabeth looked archly, and turned away.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白笑盈盈地瞟了一眼就轉身走開了。

sentences.english: Ms. Jones turned to glance at me again.
sentences.chinese: 瓊斯夫人又扭頭瞟了我一眼。

sentences.english: She glanced up at Steve, then down, then up.
sentences.chinese: 她瞟了一眼史蒂夫，然後又低下頭去，但又擡起頭來。

sentences.english: He stole a sidelong glance at the young woman sitting next to him on the train.
sentences.chinese: 在火車上他偷偷地瞟了一眼坐在身旁的年輕女子。

sentences.english: The driver kept getting in and out of his vehicle, peering down the road.
sentences.chinese: 司機在汽車裏出出進進，眼睛瞟着路面。

sentences.english: The woman without pubic hair impatiently secondhand canthus Piao Diao big Peng one eye Xun scold a way.
sentences.chinese: 白虎不耐煩的用眼角瞟了刁大鵬一眼訓斥道。

sentences.english: Nick said, glancing at me over the carburetor.
sentences.chinese: 尼克從化油器上擡眼瞟了我一下，問道。

definition: to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
(dialect) to look at
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to look askance at
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
(out of) the corner of one's eyes/peripheral vision/residual light/light of the setting sun
to turn one's head/to turn around
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to cast away/to fling aside
to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)
to take a furtive look at
to throw a glance at/to peer at/Taiwan pr. [jun4]
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
